question: For the coagulation of positively charged hydrated ferric-oxide sol, the flocculating power of the ions is in the order: [cite: 377]
explanation: According to Hardy-Schulze rule, the greater the valency of the coagulating ion (anion for positive sol), the greater its power. Order: <katex>$[Fe(CN)_6]^{4-} > PO_4^{3-} > SO_4^{2-} > Cl^-$</katex>. [cite: 380, 382]
